body:
Hello, so recently my experience has been disrupted quite an absurd amount of times on Nebula. Many players have accused me of hacking. One player recently accused me of "knockback hacks"; something in which I don't have, and something that I assume doesn't exist anyway, as a moderator on OCN (it'd probably categorized as forcefield or something similar). Since I moderate so often, I get the tendency to tell that player off by saying "no, I don't have hacks" or "I strafed and block-hit you, thus I didn't get much knockback and because I strafed you, you backed up and I knocked you into the void" or something like that.

But then it'd probably stray into a bigger argument where players complain. So my question is; how do you ignore the tendency to reply to players accusing you of hacking?
